meanings.definition: Capable of being changed back to a previous state.
meanings.sent1: The toy was revertible to its original color with a special spray.
meanings.sent2: The software had a revertible option to undo recent changes.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing to see the revertible cake transform back into a plain sponge.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was like a revertible switch, constantly flipping between happy and sad.
meanings.sent5: The magic potion had a revertible effect, turning the frog back into a prince.

meanings.definition: Able to return to a former condition or position.
meanings.sent1: The retractable ladder was revertible to its compact form for easy storage.
meanings.sent2: The flexible material was revertible to its original shape after being stretched.
meanings.sent3: The revertible rubber band kept snapping back playfully when pulled.
meanings.sent4: His trust in her was like a revertible boomerang, always coming back after being thrown away.
meanings.sent5: The old clock was revertible to its working state with a few adjustments.
